article.title: Telos Receives Defense Message System Support Contract
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Telos Corporation has been awarded a task order by the U.S. Army Information Technology Agency to provide Defense Message System (DMS) support at the Pentagon Telecommunications Center (PTC). The one-year contract includes one option year and is worth more than $32 million if all options are exercised. Under the contract awarded from the Network Centric Solutions contract vehicle, Telos will assist the PTC with integrating, operating and maintaining a single, integrated DMS at three security levels. The PTC is the Army's nerve center in the Pentagon for operating and managing the critical information technology infrastructure related to secure, organizational messaging.
